section.title: Node Remote Control
section.para: This section describes the tools and configuration options for the remote control of Qlustar cluster nodes.

section.title: Serial Console Parameter
section.para: The default configuration /etc/qlustar/pxelinux.cfg/default contains the kernel commandline that is passed to the nodes. If you need to modify the console parameter you can change it there.

listitem.para: To access the serial console use the command console-login. It allows to select the node whose console you wish to open. Depending on the type of console you need different keystrokes to exit. If you are using
then you need to type & followed by a dot (.)
then type ~ followed by a dot (.)
then use Ctrl-a followed by x

section.title: IPMI Configuration
section.para: Many computers nowadays are equipped with an Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI). Q-Leap Qlustar allows to automatically configure the ip address of these interfaces. The required configuration files are located in the directory /etc/qlustar/common/ipmi. The file overwrite-settings determines which hosts should configure the ipmi interface. It contains the name overwrite followed by a regular expression that should match the hostnames. To configure the IPMI interface of all hosts the file should look like this:
The configuration file ipmi.conf contains the default settings that can be overwritten by group specific files. The settings are:

listitem.para: the network of an already configured network interface
the network used for the IPMI network, substitutes ge_net and the result will be the new address
the IPMI channel for the lan interface

section.para: In this example a host with address 192.168.52.1 will configure the IPMI interface with address 10.0.0.1. Groups are defined in the file ipmigroups. This file contains group names followed by regular expressions that should match the members of this group.
Members of the group grp1 will use an additional file ipmi.conf.grp1 and members of the group grp2 the file ipmi.conf.grp2. In these files you can overwrite the above default values.
